_exec_summary.SummaryText:
including safety.

By utilizing PSMWriter software, all necessary employees have access to every aspect of the RMP-PSM program. This has improved Barrel Ten's ability to communicate hazardous situations to employees and contractors. In addition, PSMWriter tracks all RMP-PSM related events so that Barrel Ten's management team can ensure that the RMP-PSM program is being implemented.

Barrel Ten has implemented all aspects of the RMP-PSM program. When a RMP-PSM program requirement is completed (i.e. management of change, process hazard analysis, compliance audit, etc.) any specific action items related to that event are entered into PSMWriter, assigned a responsible person, and given a due date. Once the action item has been completed, the resolution can be documented using PSMWriter as well. A list of current or past due action items can be accessed at any time by those with access to PSMWriter.

In addition to utilizing PSMWriter to create, schedule, track, and document events, Barrel Ten has also entered into a contract with Resource Compliance to obtain help with RMP-PSM program implementation.

For the future, Barrel Ten now thinks of the RMP-PSM program as a living document. It is an interactive framework that guides safe action for Barrel Ten employees, but allows for feedback and continual improvement. Through the RMP-PSM program Barrel Ten will continue to maintain overall plant worker and public safety.

ident History

Barrel Ten has had no accidental release within the last five (5) years.

1.5 Emergency Action and Response Plan

Barrel Ten's emergency action and response program has been developed to satisfy the following requirements:
Cal/OSHAs Emergency Action Plan  Title 8 CCR §3220
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Emergency Action Plans  Title 29 CFR §1910.38
Cal/OSHAs Process Safety Management [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 8 CCR §5189(n)
U.S. Occupational Safety and Health Administrations (OSHA) Process Safety Management [Emergency Planning and Response Requirements]  Title 29 CFR §1910.119(n)
California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4.5 §2765.1-2765.2
USEPA Risk Management Program [Emergency Response Program Requirements]  Title 40 CFR §68.95
California Hazardous Materials Business Plan (HMBP) [Emergency Response Plans and Procedures]  Title 19 CCR, Division 2, Chapter 4 §2731
California Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER)  Title 8 CCR Title 8 §5192(q)
Federal Hazardous Waste Operations and Emergency Response (HAZWOPER)  Title 29 CFR §1910.120(q)

Barrel Ten has elected to use either a defensive or offensive strategy as a first response to a hazardous material release.

Selected employees who have received HAZWOPER Technician training shall take defensive or offensive steps to bring the release under control. Response activities would be done in coordination with the Local Fire Department and their Hazardous Materials Response Team. 
Every year we review with our employees our evacuation procedures in the event of an emergency, including a hazardous chemical release.

1.6 Planned Changes to Improve Safety

Barrel Ten has implemented many policies and procedures to promote overall plant, worker and public safety. Nevertheless, Barrel Ten continually strives to improve in all areas,

or sulfur dioxide in annual safety meetings. During these meeting we also discuss preventative measures, such as evacuation, in order to be prepared for a release.

Barrel Ten has also conducted an off-site consequence analysis of worst-case and alternative release scenarios for the each process. These are for the purposes of informing the public in the event of an accidental release. The results of the analyses are reported in PSMWriter and hard copy binders. 

1.3.2 Anhydrous Ammonia

The ammonia refrigeration process at the Barrel Ten facility is an integral part of the overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that this process is maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Management is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of an ammonia leak.

Our refrigeration personnel monitor the ammonia refrigeration process and keep active records of all procedures and transactions that pertain to ammonia. In addition, the process is checked frequently by one of the outside refrigeration contractors that we use. These contractors also assist in performing the annual mechanical integrity inspection of our ammonia equipment. 

1.3.3 Sulfur Dioxide

The sulfur dioxide process at the Barrel Ten facility is an integral part of overall business and operates most of the year. It is extremely important that these areas and associated injection processes are maintained and operated in a safe and efficient manner. Barrel Ten is committed to making sure that employees are made aware of the potential danger of exposure to sulfur dioxide.

Our personnel also monitor the sulfur dioxide fumigation process and keep an active log of all associated procedures and transactions. In addition, the process is checked frequently by the outside contractor that supplies the SO2 cylinders. The contractor also assists in performing the annual mechanical integrity review of our process equipment.

Description of Covered Processes

Ammonia Refrigeration

The refrigeration system is configured for a combination of flooded and pumped overfeed operation. 

Most control valve groups are located adjacent to the equipment to provide easy access. A partial list of system components includes: 

East Refrigeration Area
(2) Screw compressors
(2) Oil separators
(1) High pressure receiver
(1) Pilot receiver
(1) Liquid transfer vessel
(1) Liquid transfer pump
(1) Suction accumulator with an integral oil pot
(2) Evaporative condensers
(1) Ammonia diffusion tank
(1) Auto-purger
(3) Shell and tube wine chillers

North Refrigeration Area
(2) Reciprocating compressors
(2) Oil separators
(1) High pressure receiver
(2) Liquid transfer vessels
(2) Liquid transfer pumps
(1) Suction accumulator with an integral oil pot
(1) Pump package with two (2) integral pumps and one (1) oil pot
(2) Evaporative condensers
(1) Ammonia diffusion tank
(1) Auto-purger
(10) Shell and tube wine chillers
(1) Shell and tube glycol chiller
(28) Ammonia-jacketed wine tanks

Sulfur Dioxide

The sulfur dioxide process at Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company consists of a storage area for ton containers and dispensing locations that are referred to as:
Fill Station
Crusher Area

Process Classification

The ammonia refrigeration system at Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company consists of vessels, equipment, and valves which are interconnected by piping. As such, the refrigeration system at Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company is treated as a single process.

The sulfur dioxide process consists of ton containers which are not interconnected, but are co-located relative to each other. As such, the ton containers are treated as a single process.

1.3 General Accident Release & Chemical Specific Prevention Steps

1.3.1 General 

We inform our employees engaged in process operations of the dangers of an accidental release of anhydrous ammonia

public safety. We have: 
1. Prepared a unified program based on the PSM regulation to meet CalARP and RMP obligations as well
2. Organized the program so that it meshes closely with general business practices
3. Utilized PSMWriter software to ensure that all necessary employees have access to relevant information (SOPs, PHAs, audits, etc.)

The RMP-PSM program sets forth rules, procedures, and practices that will help our employees and neighbors protect themselves.

1.2 Process Description

Facility Overview

Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company operates a large-scale production winery in Escalon, CA. The facility utilizes anhydrous ammonia and sulfur dioxide in various capacities in the winemaking process. 

The ammonia refrigeration system provides refrigeration capacity to the following:
(13) Shell and Tube Wine Chillers
(1) Shell and Tube Glycol Chillers
(28) Jacketed Wine Tanks

The refrigeration system is located throughout the site, with equipment located in areas that are referred to as:
East Refrigeration Area
North Refrigeration Area

Facility Location

Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company is located at 21801 Highway 120, Escalon, CA 95320. The latitude and longitude of the North Refrigeration Area is 37.801496, -121.042430. The facility is located on state highway 120 in a rural area surrounded primarily by agricultural land.

According to FEMA Flood Map Service, the facility is located in an area of minimal flood hazard.

Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company is not located in an Alquist-Priolo Fault Zone as defined by the California Department of Conservation. In addition, a review of United States Geological Survey (USGS) fault maps showed that faults within close proximity are not considered high risk:
Concord Fault - <150 Years
Greenville Fault Zone - <15,000 Years
Calaveras Fault Zone - <15,000 Years
San Joaquin Fault - <130,000 Years

1. Executive Summary

This program is intended to meet the spirit and intent of the following regulations:
- California Accidental Release Prevention (CalARP) Program  Title 19 CCR, Chapter 4.5
- Federal EPA Risk Management Program (RMP)  Title 40 CFR §68
- California Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 8 CCR §5189
- Federal Process Safety Management (PSM) Program, Title 29 CFR §1910.119

Hereafter this program will be referred to as the RMP-PSM program.

This program is intended to be a living document. As such, the information, procedures, policies, and documentation that make up this program must be made easily accessible and updated as necessary. To accomplish this, Barrel Ten Quarter Circle Land Company - Escalon Facility (Barrel Ten) has elected to use PSMWriter, software developed and distributed by Resource Compliance, Inc. This software will assist us with updating, maintaining, scheduling, and tracking RMP-PSM related activities. 

1.1 Barrel Ten, Risk and Process Safety Management Program

This is to inform all interested persons, including employees, that Barrel Ten has updated their unified RMP-PSM Program. This program has been prepared to address the risks involved in operating and maintaining the following processes which have the presence of hazardous chemicals above threshold quantities: 

Process Name                     | Process Chemical               | Process Quantity (lbs.)
Ammonia Refrigeration     Anhydrous Ammonia          38,000
Sulfur Dioxide                        Sulfur Dioxide                         10,000

Our RMP-PSM program promotes overall plant, worker, and public safety. The program enables our facility to prevent the occurrence, and minimize the consequences, of significant releases of hazardous chemicals. Overall, the program is designed to prevent accidental fatalities, injuries, illnesses, and physical property damage.
